intro: Seriphidium sublessingianum, commonly known as the desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, white to yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Seriphidium sublessingianum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
